title: Gloria Dei Church National Historic Site: Photo Gallery
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Photo Gallery              Photo Gallery                    Gloria Dei Church NHS - Exterior   2 Photos  Gloria Dei (Old Swedes') Episcopal Church in South Philadelphia is the oldest church building in Pennsylvania. Built between 1698 and 1700 to serve as a Swedish Lutheran Church. It's been an Episcopal church since 1845.           Gloria Dei Church NHS - Interior   1 Photos  During the week you can take a break from the bustle outside and enjoy the architecture of this simple colonial church. Or, on Sundays you might choose to join the Gloria Dei Episcopal congregation in worship that is accompanied by the their 1300 pipe organ.
